comments:
Build ID: 3.3.1

Steps To Reproduce:
On rhel4 if I: Right click -> Open With -> Web Page Editor on a .htm file in Package Explorer I get the following error.

I get two error messages:
1) An SWT error occurred. You are recommended to exit the workbench...
2) Unhandled event loop exception
No more handles (java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no swt-mozilla-gtk-3346 or swt-mozilla-gtk in swt.library.path, java.library.path or the jar file)


More information:

The Error Log shows:

Is this consistently reproducible for you?
Does this happen on a vanilla install of Eclipse 3.3.1? (ie. just the platform no other tools installed on top?)
Hmm... There doesn't appear to be a "Web Page Editor" in the base platform.  So I guess this is probably an issue with WTP or similar; will investigate further.

I was just curious to see what happened if you opened the html file in the web browser on the base platform as that seems to be the last thing that is happening in your stack trace. 

Although I too suspect the WTP editor...
Opening the file in the base platform's internal browser does indeed work. For some reason it's broken in our Eclipse release (which has a few extra plugins).
